thread.title: Kirk Hammett: Do I Ever Get Sick Of Playing 'Enter Sandman' & 'Nothing Else Matters' [News]
thread.title_full: Kirk Hammett: Do I Ever Get Sick Of Playing 'Enter Sandman' & 'Nothing Else Matters' [News]

title: Kirk Hammett: Do I Ever Get Sick Of Playing 'Enter Sandman' & 'Nothing Else Matters' [News]
text: UG News editor since early 2013. King Crimson fan. I handle the news around here. Posted 16 hours ago 13 Kirk Hammett was recently asked whether playing " Enter Sandman " so often gets boring after all these years. The guitarist told Eddie Trunk : "From my point of view, from a guitar-playing point of view, Metallica songs are really fun to play. That fun factor is just there every time you play the song. "But more importantly, what I like about playing that song - which never really gets tiring for me - is the effect it has on people when we play the first minute or so. People just transform, it's nuts! They get so excited, so happy, it's like a blast of energy and adrenaline." Kirk added: "The other song that's very similar [in that aspect] is ' Nothing Else Matters ' - whenever we play it, the effect it has on people is amazing!" Interestingly enough, neither "Sandman" nor "Nothing Else Matters" are not among Top 5 on the list of most performed Metallica songs ever. As you can see below, based on the band's official data , "Sandman" comes in at No. 6, while the ballad is at No. 9.
